result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breanta Justice Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Breanta Justice Johnson.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing with Co-Defendant Case, 22CF493. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested a plea date. State to comply with Victim Notification. Case adjourned for Plea hearing, Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson in Court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing with Co-Defendant Case, 22CF493. Discussion placed on the record. Defense is still reviewing extensive discovery material. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson in Court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Scheduling Conference proceeded.

Defense received extensive discovery material from the State. Defense requested time to review and meet with Defendant. Court granted request. Court ordered case adjourned for status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Defense Demand for Discovery and Inspection; received and filed.

Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson in custody.  Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. State to provide Defense counsel with discovery material and an offer via digital system. Case adjourned for BAIL REVIEW, Branch 46. 
E-FILED: Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense - NO REIMBURSEMENT FROM DEFENDANT; signed and filed.
Attorney Thomas Harris

Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson in Court, in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel. Discussion placed on the record. Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris, present in Court, to represent Defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant DOES NOT REIMBURSE THE COUNTY. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am before Commissioner Phillips.

COURT CONTINUED TOLLING OF TIME LIMITS FOR PRELIMINARY HEARING.

ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am. 
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON to Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Defendant WILL BE PRODUCED IN-PERSON. 
Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office.

Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case charged by AAG Jacob Corr. Per Chief Judge Directive 21-13, this case is transferred to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.

Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with AIR DOB: 11/9/1995; JAW DOB:1/13/1977; George Webb's Restaurant; HKW DOB: 8/22/2002; JDC DOB:
9/24/2001
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered do-defendants kept separate while in custody.

Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Breanta Justice Johnson in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Breanta Justice Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
